column4: I installed ubuntu 9.10 on my dell laptop and while starting the computer, it shows grub loading but no menu appears and directly logins to ubuntu
There is a checkmark in the install that bypasses the login... edit /etc/X11/xorg.conf and remove or comment out autologin
please read carefully ... I already answered your question... be patient please
Warning: unknown mime-type for "/etc/X11/xorg.conf" -- using "application/octet-stream"
what were you trying to view??? .. probably don't have the appropriate reader for the octet-stream , which could be a number of things
What should i do then
answer my ???
i tried to edit the file you said
sorry ... try from terminal ... gksudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf
there is no file called xorg.conf there
i did a blank document came
/etc/X11/xorg.conf .... the first X is in caps the second x is lowercase
yes.......i did as you are saying and a file opens of the same name but it is blank
using gksudo?
yes bro

I am a little behind I am running 9.04 ... and 8.04, so I may not be able to help, I know that if you do a proper reinstall you will find that you did not read correctly when installing ... it is autologin and if checked you will not see a login screen, it will just login as the first user
i got the problem and thanks for the help
np
goto System>Administration>Login Window... in the security tab ... autologin is the top option ... as for grub ... Press ESC while it says Grub Loading the first time
i get user accounts but i dont get to chose between operating systems
aaah ... you need to edit /boot/grub/menu.lst  and add the other operating system to the list ... see !grub
ubottu i know i have grub2 1.97 version but how to edit and put other operating system there
gksudo gedit /boot/grub/menu.lst   . to edit the grub list ... see the howto's for info on how to properly add os's to the list
i want how to only?
